Brush and floss every day. It's damn simple, and you people need to quit whining about it and just do it. I promise, it will go a long way and then you won't have to spend thousands of dollars having surgery that you really don't want.

Went bowling with some friends one night and was next to a very loud and obnoxious party. Actually, it was one lady in particular that really annoyed us. She was in her mid 30s, extremely overweight with a volume and opinion to match. Later that night it was her turn to bowl. As she released the ball, her sausage fingers became wedged in the finger holes and she went flying down the lane. I've never seen a 300+ person take a fall like that. She actually slid a good 6 feet or so down the lane. She got up (without ease) and ran into the bathroom. We couldn't stop chuckling. Eventually an employee came to "wash off" the lane. It was like they came to wipe off all the grease she'd left from her fall.
TLDR; Fat annoying lady got her fingers stuck in a bowling ball and bowled herself down the lane. Bowling employee literally wiped off the fat she left.

WRITING.TITLE: A question about adding chocolate chips to cupcakes
WRITING.TEXT: I'm making some very chocolatey chocolate cupcakes for my sister birthday tomorrow. However, I wanted to jazz up a simple chocolate cupcake. My first thought was to add chocolate chips but I've never attempted that before. Anything I should know? Do I just mix some semi-sweet morsels in with the batter? I'd appreciate any tips from you veteran cupcake bakers!

I was at a stop light on my college campus and saw a meter maid next to me just waiting for the final seconds of a meter to run out. I had some change in my car and waved down the meter maid to put in the meter. A group of loiterers cheered me on as I drove away. I don't need a 'pay it forward' moment. Just loads of applause.
